value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. However, if the concatenation needs to be done dynamically. ConcatenateX is a very helpful DAX function to achieve such results. It is
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dx8PBnDEMzU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Measure in the Axis of the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: If you even need to show your DAX measures in a chart without a dimension to slice and dice it, you won’t get a great experience in the visual. In this video, I’ll share a trick that you can use to have a nice visualization like what you see in the above screenshot. Download the file and study more from

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #08: Add filters using IN

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Connect to a power bi model in the service using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You asked me to make a video when it was possible to connect power bi service to DAX Studio, so here it is :)  Two big "but"... 1. It works only with Power BI Premium 2. Read-only for now.  And here is the URL to connect: powerbi://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/workspacename  How about you let us know how

I will then unpivot them using Power Query so you can see the difference, and how Power Query can be faster and more efficient for cleaning data.  Have
